original_title: Former NYPD detective calls D.C. police handling of intern death 'unusual' | Fox News
article_summary: Mother of slain congressional intern calls for federalization of DC police, citing lack of communication and unusual handling of her son's case. Former NYPD detective Pat Brosnan agrees, stating that families of homicide victims are usually kept informed. The Metropolitan Police Department is investigating the shooting and offers a $40,000 reward for information leading to an arrest.</s>
